rtc.internal.ChannelCollection.name: rtc.internal.ChannelCollection
rtc.internal.ChannelCollection.description: Helper which handles DataChannel negotiation for RemotePeer

rtc.internal.Promise.name: rtc.internal.Promise
rtc.internal.Promise.description: Alias for native promises or a polyfill if not supported

rtc.internal.Deferred.name: rtc.internal.Deferred
rtc.internal.Deferred.description: Helper to implement deferred execution with promises

rtc.internal.StreamCollection.name: rtc.internal.StreamCollection
rtc.internal.StreamCollection.description: Helper handling the mapping of streams for RemotePeer

rtc.signaling.MucSignalingPeer.name: rtc.signaling.MucSignalingPeer
rtc.signaling.MucSignalingPeer.description:
Signaling peer for multi user chats.

For a detailed description of the signaling protocol see `rtc.signaling.MucSignaling`

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to the siganling server

params.name: peer_id
params.description: The id of the remote peer

params.name: status
params.description: The status of the remote peer

params.name: first
params.description: Whether the local peer was in the room before the remote peer

rtc.signaling.MucSignaling.name: rtc.signaling.MucSignaling

params.name: channel
params.description: The channel to the signaling server

rtc.signaling.PalavaSignalingPeer.name: rtc.signaling.PalavaSignalingPeer
rtc.signaling.PalavaSignalingPeer.description: Signaling peer compatible with the framing of palava signaling

rtc.signaling.PalavaSignaling.name: rtc.signaling.PalavaSignaling
rtc.signaling.PalavaSignaling.description: Signaling implementation compatible with the framing of palava signaling

rtc.signaling.Signaling.name: rtc.signaling.Signaling
rtc.signaling.Signaling.description:
Concept of a class implementing signaling. Might use a `rtc.signaling.Channel` to abstract the connection to the server.

You do not have to extend this claass, just implement the functionality.

rtc.signaling.SignalingPeer.name: rtc.signaling.SignalingPeer
rtc.signaling.SignalingPeer.description:
Concept of a class implementing a signaling connection to a peer.

You do not have to extend this class, just implement the functionality.

rtc.signaling.Channel.name: rtc.signaling.Channel
rtc.signaling.Channel.description:
Concept of a class implementing a signaling channel. Might be used by signaling implementations to connect to a signaling server.

You do not have to extend this class, just implement the functionality.

rtc.DataChannel.name: rtc.DataChannel
rtc.DataChannel.description: A wrapper for RTCDataChannel. Used to transfer custom data between peers.

params.name: max_buffer
params.description: The size of the send buffer after which we will delay sending

rtc.LocalPeer.name: rtc.LocalPeer
rtc.LocalPeer.description: Represents the local user of the room

rtc.PeerConnection.name: rtc.PeerConnection
rtc.PeerConnection.description:
Wrapper around native RTCPeerConnection

Provides events for new streams and data channels. Signaling information has
to be forwarded from events emitted by this object to the remote
PeerConnection.

params.name: offering
params.description: True if the local peer should initiate the connection

rtc.RemotePeer.name: rtc.RemotePeer
rtc.RemotePeer.description: Represents a remote user of the room

params.name: signaling
params.description: The signaling connection to the peer

params.name: options
params.description: The options object as passed to `Room`

rtc.Room.name: rtc.Room
rtc.Room.description: A virtual room which connects multiple Peers

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the room. Will be passed on to signaling

params.name: signaling
params.description: The signaling to be used. If you pass a string it will be interpreted as a websocket address and a palava signaling connection will be established with it.

params.name: options
params.description: Various options to be used in connections created by this room

props.name: auto_connect
props.description: Whether remote peers are connected automatically or an explicit `RemotePeer.connect()` call is needed

props.name: stun
props.description: The URI of the STUN server to use

rtc.Stream.name: rtc.Stream
rtc.Stream.description: A wrapper around an HTML5 MediaStream

classitems.description: A new data channel is available

classitems.description: Set the local channel description.

classitems.description: Resolves promises waiting for the given DataChannel

return.description: Promise for the DataChannel

params.name: data

classitems.name: connect

return.description: Promise which will be resolved once the connection is established

classitems.description: Close the connection to the remote peer

classitems.description: Message received from peer through signaling
classitems.name: message

classitems.name: left

classitems.description: A new stream is available from the peer
classitems.name: stream_added

classitems.description: A new data channel is available from the peer
classitems.name: data_channel_added

classitems.description: Send a message to the peer through signaling
classitems.name: message

return.description: Promise which is resolved when the data was sent

classitems.description: Connect to the remote peer to exchange streams and create data channels
classitems.name: connect

return.description: Promise which will resolved when the connection is established

classitems.description: Closes the connection to the peer
classitems.name: close

classitems.description: Get a stream from the peer. Has to be sent by the remote peer to succeed.
classitems.name: stream

return.description: Promise of the stream

classitems.description:
Add local stream to be sent to this remote peer

If you use this method you have to set `auto_connect` to `false` in the options object and call `connect()` manually on all remote peers.
classitems.name: addStream

params.name: stream
params.description: The stream, a promise to the stream or the configuration to create a stream with `rtc.Stream.createStream()`

return.description: Promise of the stream which was added

classitems.description: Get a data channel to the remote peer. Has to be added by local and remote side to succeed.
classitems.name: channel

return.description: Promise of the data channel

classitems.description:
Add data channel which will be negotiated with this remote peer

If you use this method you have to set `auto_connect` to `false` in the options object and call `connect()` manually on all remote peers.
classitems.name: addDataChannel

classitems.description: A new peer is encountered in the room. Fires on new remote peers after joining and for all peers in the room when joining.
classitems.name: peer_jopined

classitems.description: The connection to the room was closed
classitems.name: closed

classitems.description: Joins the room. Initiates connection to signaling server if not done before.
classitems.name: join

return.description: A promise which will be resolved once the room was joined

classitems.description: Leaves the room and closes all established peer connections
classitems.name: leave

classitems.description: Cleans up all resources used by the room.
classitems.name: leave

classitems.description: Get the id of the stream. This is neither user defined nor human readable.
classitems.name: id

return.description: The id of the underlying stream

classitems.description: Checks whether the stream has any tracks of the given type
classitems.name: hasTracks

params.name: type
params.description: The type of track to check for

return.description: The amount of tracks of the given type

classitems.description: Gets the tracks of the given type
classitems.name: getTracks

params.name: type
params.description: The type of tracks to get

return.description: An Array of the tracks

classitems.description: Mutes or unmutes tracks of the stream
classitems.name: mute

params.name: type
params.description: The type of tracks to mute or unmute

return.description: Whether the tracks were muted or unmuted

classitems.description: Toggles the mute state of tracks of the stream
classitems.name: toggleMute

params.name: type
params.description: The type of tracks to mute or unmute

return.description: Whether the tracks were muted or unmuted

classitems.description: Stops the stream
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Creates a stream using `getUserMedia()`
classitems.name: createStream

return.description: Promise to the stream

example:
var stream = rtc.Stream.createStream({audio: true, video: false});
    rtc.MediaDomElement($('video'), stream);
